articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 10 people were killed and 30 injured when a truck drove into a large crowd on Canal and Bourbon Street in New Orleans' French Quarter early on Wednesday.
articles.title: At least 10 dead after truck crashes into New Orleans crowd, city agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant, who had often taken an independent line against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right government allies, said on Wednesday he was resigning from parliament.
articles.title: Israel's former defence chief Gallant quits parliament

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Russian natural gas exports via Soviet-era pipelines running through Ukraine to Europe were halted in the early hours of New Year's Day as a transit deal expired and warring Moscow and Kyiv have failed to reach an agreement to continue the flows.
articles.title: Russian gas exports to Europe via Ukraine halted as transit deal expires

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several people were killed in a shooting at a restaurant near Montenegro's historical capital of Cetinje, local media cited the country's police as saying in a statement on Wednesday.
articles.title: Several dead in shooting incident in Montenegro-local media citing police

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military kept up the pressure on northern Gaza on Wednesday, striking in a suburb of Gaza City, medics said, and told residents in a central part of the enclave to evacuate from an area where militants were firing rockets.
articles.title: Israel strikes Gaza City suburb, Palestinian medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania and Bulgaria scrapped land border controls to become full members of the European Union's Schengen free-travel area on Wednesday, joining an expanded bloc of countries whose residents can travel without passport checks.
articles.title: Romania, Bulgaria fully join EU's borderless Schengen zone

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian Authority suspended the broadcast of Qatar's Al Jazeera TV temporarily over "inciting material," Palestinian official news agency WAFA reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Palestinian Authority suspends broadcast of Qatar's Al Jazeera TV temporarily

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Syrian delegation led by newly appointed Foreign Minister Asaad Hassan al-Shibani arrived in Riyadh on Wednesday in its first official visit abroad, Syrian state news agency SANA reported, citing a foreign ministry source.
articles.title: Syrian foreign minister arrives in Saudi Arabia with delegation

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The city of New Orleans had begun replacing security barriers along Bourbon Street before Wednesday's truck attack, which killed at least 10 people and wounded more than 30.
articles.title: New Orleans was replacing street barriers at time of truck attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese meteorological data shows 2024 was the warmest year for the country since comparable records began more than six decades ago, the second straight year in which milestones were broken.
articles.title: In 2024, China saw warmest year in decades, breaking records yet again
